result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:10 PM Defendant Daniel A. Martinez in court by video in custody with attorney Taylor E Klokow by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $500 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim H.N.M. or J.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No intentional contact with Officer D.A.J.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
